remarks: If ` F ` is piecewise coninuous and ` D ` is continuous, then ` G ` is continuous.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
statement:
fourierdlem84.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. RR ) $.
fourierdlem84.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
fourierdlem84.f $e |- ( ph -> F : RR --> RR ) $.
fourierdlem84.xre $e |- ( ph -> X e. RR ) $.
fourierdlem84.p $e |- P = ( m e. NN |-> { p e. ( RR ^m ( 0 ... m ) ) | ( ( ( p ` 0 ) = ( A + X ) /\ ( p ` m ) = ( B + X ) ) /\ A. i e. ( 0 ..^ m ) ( p ` i ) < ( p ` ( i + 1 ) ) ) } ) $.
fourierdlem84.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN ) $.
fourierdlem84.v $e |- ( ph -> V e. ( P ` M ) ) $.
fourierdlem84.fcn $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. ( 0 ..^ M ) ) -> ( F |` ( ( V ` i ) (,) ( V ` ( i + 1 ) ) ) ) e. ( ( ( V ` i ) (,) ( V ` ( i + 1 ) ) ) -cn-> CC ) ) $.
fourierdlem84.r $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. ( 0 ..^ M ) ) -> R e. ( ( F |` ( ( V ` i ) (,) ( V ` ( i + 1 ) ) ) ) limCC ( V ` i ) ) ) $.
fourierdlem84.l $e |- ( ( ph /\ i e. ( 0 ..^ M ) ) -> L e. ( ( F |` ( ( V ` i ) (,) ( V ` ( i + 1 ) ) ) ) limCC ( V ` ( i + 1 ) ) ) ) $.
fourierdlem84.q $e |- Q = ( i e. ( 0 ... M ) |-> ( ( V ` i ) - X ) ) $.
fourierdlem84.o $e |- O = ( m e. NN |-> { p e. ( RR ^m ( 0 ... m ) ) | ( ( ( p ` 0 ) = A /\ ( p ` m ) = B ) /\ A. i e. ( 0 ..^ m ) ( p ` i ) < ( p ` ( i + 1 ) ) ) } ) $.
fourierdlem84.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. ( RR -cn-> RR ) ) $.
fourierdlem84.g $e |- G = ( s e. ( A [,] B ) |-> ( ( F ` ( X + s ) ) x. ( D ` s ) ) ) $.
fourierdlem84 $p |- ( ph -> G e. L^1 ) $.
